intro: Thamnea teres, commonly known as the narrow-leaf thamnea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Thamnea teres is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soils with partial to full shade.
